thread.title: UMass vs. Toledo: Scouting the Rockets by the numbers
thread.title_full: UMass vs. Toledo: Scouting the Rockets by the numbers

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass vs. Toledo: Scouting the Rockets by the numbers
text:
Here's a look at some numbers and statistics concerning Toledo to consider as the University of Massachusetts football team prepares for Saturday's home game against the Rockets . 41.7: Toledo's scoring average vs. the MAC 
And that's after having scored only 24 points in a win over Ball State three weeks ago. 7.9: Terry Swanson's YPC 
The sophomore has stepped into the lead role at running back and is 15th in the nation in average yards per carry. He gashed UMass for near 100 yards and two touchdowns last season. 0: Sacks allowed by the Toledo offensive line 
Despite losing all five of its 2014 starters to graduation, Toledo's offensive line has been one of the best in the MAC. Again. 
[ LISTEN: UMass Podcast: Toledo preview with the Toledo Blade's Nick Piotrowicz ] 32-13: Matt Campbell's coaching record at Toledo 
The 35-year-old's name has been popping up left and right as the next MAC coach to strike it out in the Power Five. With a record like that, it's easy to understand why. 40: Red-zone conversion rate for Toledo opponents 
The Rockets are first in the MAC when it comes to keep opposing offenses off the board after driving into the red zone. In 15 opportunities, they've allowed just two touchdowns and four field goals. 4: Touchdown passes for Phillip Ely last week 
The senior and former Alabama quarterback hasn't been asked to carry the Rockets this season, but he's coming off his best performance of the year last week against Eastern Michigan: 18 of 27 for 327 yards, four touchdowns and no interceptions. 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
